title: (x) Font ID / Drippy 70's Font Suggestions? - Candice, various suggestions {R, Lex}
content:
Hello Everybody,

I'm looking for a drippy, 70's ish font, similar to the one in the attached image. Unfortunately, I can't seem to find anything like it online. Any suggestions or even the name of the attached font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120504012206im_/http:/typophile.com/files/texta_th_4146.jpg)
author: PrettyGeekySis

comments.content: This is [Candice](http://web.archive.org/web/20120504012206/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/candice_com_regular/?&sample_text=Pinkzap&sample_size=96&update=0&update=0) — it never seems to grow old. And I know what I [say](http://web.archive.org/web/20120504012206/http:/typophile.com/node/68327).

Other "drippy 70s" fonts:

[Motter Femina](http://web.archive.org/web/20120504012206/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=motter+femina&q=Go)

[Lazybones](http://web.archive.org/web/20120504012206/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=lazybones&q=Go)

[Kalligraphia](http://web.archive.org/web/20120504012206/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=kalligraphia&q=Go) (although it's much older than the 70s).

- Lex
